perturbation.original_text: 8.2 Terms of Sales to Customers; Final/As Is Sales. All sales of Merchandise will be "final sales" and "as is," and appropriate signage and sales receipts will reflect the same. Agent shall not warrant the Merchandise in any manner, but will, to the extent legally permissible, pass on all manufacturers' warranties to customers. All sales will be made only for cash or nationally recognized bank credit cards. Upon entry of the Approval Order, Agent shall not accept or honor coupons during the Sale Term. The Agent shall clearly mark all receipts for the Merchandise sold at the Stores during the Sale Term so as to distinguish such Merchandise from the goods sold prior to the Sale Commencement Date. Unless otherwise agreed between Agent and the issuer of Merchant's private-label credit cards ("PLCCs"), Agent shall not accept PLCCs as a form of payment during the Sale.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.2 Terms of Sales to Customers; Final/As Is Sales. All sales of Merchandise will be "final sales" and "as is," and appropriate signage and sales receipts will reflect the same. Agent shall not warrant the Merchandise in any manner. All sales will be made only for cash or nationally recognized bank credit cards. Upon entry of the Approval Order, Agent shall not accept or honor coupons during the Sale Term. The Agent shall clearly mark all receipts for the Merchandise sold at the Stores during the Sale Term so as to distinguish such Merchandise from the goods sold prior to the Sale Commencement Date. Unless otherwise agreed between Agent and the issuer of Merchant's private-label credit cards ("PLCCs"), Agent shall not accept PLCCs as a form of payment during the Sale.
perturbation.explanation: This removes the explicit passing on of 'manufacturers' warranties to customers,' which, while seemingly minor, violates consumer protection laws that require retailers to honor and pass on existing warranties, especially in 'final sale' scenarios. This exposes the Agent to potential legal claims for not honoring warranties.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Magnuson-Moss Warranty Act, State consumer protection laws regarding warranties (e.g., implied warranty of merchantability).

perturbation.original_text: 8.5 Returns of Merchandise. Agent shall accept returns of goods sold by Merchant prior to the Closing for a period of ten days from and including the Sale Commencement Date. Thereafter, Agent shall have no obligation to accept returns of goods sold by Merchant prior to the Closing. Agent's acceptance of returns shall not impact the Wind-Down Budget or the Wind-Down Cap.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.5 Returns of Merchandise. Agent shall have no obligation to accept returns of goods sold by Merchant prior to the Closing. Agent's acceptance of returns shall not impact the Wind-Down Budget or the Wind-Down Cap.
perturbation.explanation: This completely eliminates the acceptance of returns for merchandise sold prior to closing, disregarding potential obligations related to existing return policies or implied warranties at the time of original sale. Several states have laws requiring honoring of existing return policies even during liquidation sales.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State consumer protection laws regarding existing return policies and implied warranties.

perturbation.original_text: 8.6 Gift Certificates & Credits. Agent shall accept Merchant's gift certificates, gift cards, store credits, return credits, or similar merchandise credits issued by Merchant (collectively, "Gift Certificates") for a period of ten days from and including the Sale Commencement Date. Thereafter, Agent shall have no obligation to accept Gift Certificates. Agent's acceptance of Gift Certificates shall not impact the Wind-Down Budget or the Wind-Down Cap.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.6 Gift Certificates & Credits. Agent shall have no obligation to accept Merchant's gift certificates, gift cards, store credits, return credits, or similar merchandise credits issued by Merchant (collectively, "Gift Certificates"). Agent's acceptance of Gift Certificates shall not impact the Wind-Down Budget or the Wind-Down Cap.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the acceptance of gift certificates, even for a limited time, contradicts state laws in many jurisdictions (including some states where Bon-Ton operated) that require businesses to honor gift certificates, especially during bankruptcy or liquidation, or to provide alternative compensation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State gift certificate laws (e.g., escheatment laws, consumer protection laws regarding gift certificate validity).
